FuncDef:
The apply origin command sets the Origin attribute of BGP routes.
The undo apply origin command cancels the configuration. The apply origin command sets the Origin attribute of BGP routes. The undo apply origin command cancels the configuration. By default, no Origin attribute is set for BGP routes.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the Origin attribute of BGP routes to EGP.
-

Specifies an AS number.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.The value is in the format of x.y, in which x and y are integers ranging from 1 to 65535 and from 0 to 65535, respectively.

Sets the Origin attribute of BGP routes to IGP.
-

Sets the Origin attribute of BGP routes to unknown.
-

ExtraInfo: The Origin attribute, as a proprietary attribute of BGP, defines the origin of a route. It identifies how a BGP route is generated. You can use the apply origin command to set the origin of BGP routes.
